Explanation: The transformation \\( f(y) \\) by performing L, application of P(s), and inverse L fundamentally alters the initial function through convolution and multiplication by poles or zeros introduced by P(s). This affect the solution path, resulting in a different state at time T from just evolving under \\( Ky \\).
